content:
It sounds like you're excited to share your enthusiasm for fitness with your coworkers! Inviting John to the Zumba class on Fridays could be a great idea, but it's essential to consider a few things before extending the invitation.

Firstly, make sure John is interested in fitness or has expressed any inclination towards trying Zumba. You wouldn't want to put him on the spot or make him feel uncomfortable if he's not into group fitness classes.

Secondly, consider your workplace dynamics. Are you and John close enough to suggest a social activity outside of work, or might it be seen as invasive or unprofessional? Make sure your invitation won't blur any boundaries or make John feel obligated to accept.

Lastly, think about John's schedule and availability. Is he usually free on Fridays, or might he have other commitments?

If you've thought through these factors and feel confident that John might enjoy the class, go for it! It's great that you're enthusiastic about sharing your positive experiences with others, and who knows, you might just inspire John to start a new fitness routine.

By the way, that's awesome that Emily enjoyed the yoga class with you on Wednesday! It's fantastic that you're spreading the fitness love to your friends and coworkers.
